description: Alteration of roof from hip-to-gable end; rear roof extension incorporating Juliet balcony; installation of three rooflights to front roofslope; removal of side chimney; alterations to side elevation fenestration involving removal of window and installation of new window
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing / document title number(s): ST_JULY 23_18 CAR_00, ST_JULY 23_18 CAR_001 rev D, ST_JULY 23_18 CAR_002 rev D, ST_JULY 23_18 CAR_003 rev D, ST_JULY 23_18 CAR_004 rev D, ST_JULY 23_18 CAR_005 rev D, ST_JULY 23_18 CAR_006 rev D, ST_JULY 23_18 CAR_007 rev D, ST_JULY 23_18 CAR_008 rev D, Fire Safety Report, Design and Access Statement.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).
| No windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the hereby permitted extension.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 2.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).

| The windows inserted in the side elevation of the proposed gable end shall be obscure glazed and non-opening (where openable parts less than 1.7m above floor) unless otherwise confirmed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
Reason: To safeguard neighbouring amenity from light pollution in accordance with policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD.
